entry.title: BLOWING SNOW ADVISORY , Mary's Harbour
entry.summary: Persons in or near this area should be on the lookout for adverse weather conditions and take necessary safety precautions. Issued: 10:42 PM NST Friday 23 December 2022

entry.title: Current Conditions: Cloudy, -10.3°C
entry.summary:
Observed at: Mary's Harbour 12:03 AM NST Saturday 24 December 2022
Condition: Cloudy
Temperature: -10.3°C
Pressure: 103.3 kPa
Visibility: 14.5 km
Humidity: 96 %
Wind Chill: -13
Dewpoint: -10.8°C
Wind: W 5 km/h
Air Quality Health Index: N/A

entry.title: Friday night: Partly cloudy. Low minus 14 except minus 20 inland.
entry.summary: A few clouds. Increasing cloudiness overnight. Low minus 14 except minus 20 inland. Forecast issued 4:30 PM NST Friday 23 December 2022

entry.title: Saturday: Snow and blowing snow. High minus 1.
entry.summary: Cloudy. Snow and blowing snow beginning near noon. Amount 5 to 10 cm. Wind becoming southeast 30 km/h gusting to 50 then increasing to 50 gusting to 80 near noon. High minus 1. Wind chill near minus 13. Forecast issued 4:30 PM NST Friday 23 December 2022

entry.title: Saturday night: Snow mixed with ice pellets. Temperature rising to plus 1 in the evening then falling.
entry.summary: Snow at times mixed with ice pellets ending near midnight then mainly cloudy. Snow and ice pellet amount 5 cm. Wind southeast 50 km/h gusting to 80 becoming southwest 20 gusting to 40 near midnight. Temperature rising to plus 1 in the evening then falling. Wind chill minus 9 overnight. Forecast issued 4:30 PM NST Friday 23 December 2022

entry.title: Sunday: A mix of sun and cloud. High minus 3.
entry.summary: A mix of sun and cloud. High minus 3. Forecast issued 4:30 PM NST Friday 23 December 2022

entry.title: Sunday night: Chance of flurries. Low minus 7. POP 40%
entry.summary: Cloudy periods with 40 percent chance of flurries. Low minus 7. Forecast issued 4:30 PM NST Friday 23 December 2022
